Description: Small hemispherical gold artefact made of an embossed sheet of metal, perhaps a fitting from a piece of jewellery. The internal surface is covered by a thick layer of a kind of dark brown resin. the edge is slightly dented.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the denuded surface of the site or the neighbourhood ? (?)
Curator's comments: The possible provenance from Tell Dafana is inferred by the context of the item in the Museum register list. If from Tell Dafana, possibly one of the "multitude of fragments of goldwork picked by the Bedawin who hunt over the denuded surface of the site" mentioned by Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 74.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.84, p.186, pl.28)
